title: P22 & The International House of Fonts News Release
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829183604/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 29.Jul.2005 2.39pm 

Buffalo, NY August 1st, 2005

P22 and the International House of Fonts introduce two new fonts, Larkin  
and Numismatic.

Larkin  
———  
The Larkin font is based on the logotypes of the Buffalo, NY-based Larkin  
Company that originated in the late 1800s as a soap company and grew into a  
gigantic mail-order, chain store. This lettering style is an unusual  
combination of Germanic Blackletter and Romanized capitals with an Italic  
slant. It is evocative of “old world” craftsmanship and early 20th century  
romanticism.

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/larkin.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829183604/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/larkin.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/larkin.html")

Numismatic  
—————  
Numismatic was a font offered by the Devinne Press in 1905. It was based on  
letters, Arabic figures and ornaments used by designers and engravers of  
seals, coins, medals and inscriptions upon metal or stone during the  
fifteenth and sixteenth centuries.  
 [http://www.p22.com/ihof/numismatic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829183604/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/numismatic.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/numismatic.html")

In addition to our latest font releases, P22 is offering the new Lanston  
t-shirt unveiled at Typecon in New York City. The shirt features Goudy  
Heavyface on the front and a Monotype font matrix case on the back.

[http://www.p22.com/products/shirts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829183604/http:/www.p22.com/products/shirts.html "http://www.p22.com/products/shirts.html")
